doc.after: Atmospheric circulation is the large scale movement of air through the troposphere and the means with ocean circulation by which heat is distributed around Earth The large scale structure of the atmospheric circulation varies from year to year but the basic structure remains fairly constant because it is determined by Earth s rotation rate and the difference in solar radiation between the equator and poles
